clinical_study.brief_title: Fat Grafting in Skin-grafted Deep Burn Scars
clinical_study.official_title: Fat Grafting in Immature Skin-grafted Burn Scars: a Randomised Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: fat grafting in human skin-grafted immature burn scars histological, clinical and photographic follow-up

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective: A randomised clinical trial was performed to determine the effect of autologous fat grafting on scar formation in early skin-grafted deep burn wounds.
Methods: Included patients received split-thickness skin grafting procedures for deep burn wounds less than 3 months ago. A homogenous scar area in each patient was divided into two equal parts. One part was treated with transcutaneous sharp needle autologous fat grafting, the adjacent part with transcutaneous saline injection as control. Results were evaluated by clinical assessment with scar scale questionnaires, histological examination, and objective scar assessment with Cutometer, Mexameter, Tewameter and Corneometer.

study_design_info.masking_description: 2 skin zones per participant, A and B, 1 is treated, 1 is placebo coin toss determines which zone will be treated, this information is kept in sealed envelope

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement of scar quality by histological assessment
primary_outcome.description: histology of scar tissue, scoring by 2 independent blinded anatomopathologists, (numerical scoring of fibroblast activity, collagen and elastin organisation, vascularity) scoring range min 1(close to normal tissue) - 3 (scar characteristics)

primary_outcome.measure: improvement of scar quality by physiological testing with cutometer
primary_outcome.description: measures elasticity of the scar; micrometer; higher values better outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement of scar quality by subjective evaluation with numerical Vancouver Scar Scale
primary_outcome.description: numerical score 0 to 13; ranges vascularity, height/thickness, pliability, and pigmentation

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement of scar quality by subjective evaluation with numerical POSAS (Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale) Scale
primary_outcome.description: numerical score 5 to 50: VSS plus surface area; patient assessments of pain, itching, color, stiffness, thickness, relief

primary_outcome.measure: improvement of scar quality by physiological testing with TEWA-meter (Trans Epidermal Water Loss-meter)
primary_outcome.description: measures transepidermal water loss; g/m2/h; higher values worse outcome

primary_outcome.measure: physiological testing of scar tissue by corneometer
primary_outcome.description: measures hydration of the epidermis; corneometer units, higher values better outcome

arm_group.description: procedure/surgery: fat grafting injection of scar

intervention.description: liposuction, processing/ cleaning of fat tissue; reinjection with sharp needle transcutaneous

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- early skin-grafted deep burn scars
- otherwise healthy
Exclusion Criteria:
- concomitant disease

responsible_party.investigator_title: Clinical Professor, Head of Plastic Surgery, Principal Investigator
